definitions.definition: An implement for washing floors or similar, made of a piece of cloth, or a collection of thrums , or coarse yarn , fastened to a handle .
A wash with a mop; the act of mopping.
examples: He gave the floor a quick mop to soak up the spilt juice.

definitions.definition: ( humorous ) A dense head of hair .
examples: He ran a comb through his mop and hurried out the door.

definitions.definition: ( British , dialect , West Midlands ) An annual fair where servants were historically hired.
( British , obsolete ) A tassel worn in a buttonhole to indicate ones occupation in such a fair.
( African-American Vernacular , MLE , slang ) A firearm particularly if it has a large magazine ( compare broom , but still can be related to MP )
( graffiti ) A squeezable high-flow paint marker with an extra-wide felt or foam tip.
( fishing ) A row of ropes dragged along the seabed for catching starfish .

main_definition: ( British , dialect , obsolete ) The young of any animal .
secondary_definitions: ( British , dialect , obsolete ) A young girl ; a moppet .
